name: Idiopathic Chronic Intestinal Pseudo-Obstruction with Secondary Sclerosing Cholangitis
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal bloating and pain, yellow eyes, and inability to pass stool for 5 days
physical_findings: hepatomegaly with right upper quadrant tenderness
treatment: surgical consultation for possible subtotal colectomy
prognosis: Guarded. Progressive disease with 5-year survival ~60% due to nutritional complications and liver failure
description: A rare motility disorder characterized by recurrent obstruction symptoms without mechanical blockage, complicated by secondary autoimmune-mediated bile duct injury. Pathogenesis involves both enteric nervous system dysfunction and immune-mediated biliary strictures. Diagnostic hallmarks include manometric evidence of dysmotility plus cholangiographic 'beading' pattern.
multiple_choice: Idiopathic Chronic Intestinal Pseudo-Obstruction with Secondary Sclerosing Cholangitis
